00013 /*
00014  * returns 1 if the year is a leap year, 0 otherwise.
00015  */
00016 int Lgm_LeapYear(int year) {
00017 
00018     if ((year%100 == 0)&&(year%400 != 0)) return(0);
00019     else if (year%4 == 0) return(1);
00020     else return(0);
00021 
00022 }

00070 double Lgm_GetLeapSeconds( double JD, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00071 
00072     Lgm_LeapSeconds *l;
00073     int             i;
00074     double          MJD, TAI_Minus_UTC = 0.0;
00075 
00076     l = &(c->l);
00077 
00078     /*
00079      * For dates 1972 to present, leap seconds are stored in the
00080      * Lgm_LeapSeconds structure.
00081      * Parse list in reverse order.
00082      */
00083     for (i=l->nLeapSecondDates-1; i>=0; i--) {
00084         // do > and not >= here because the 86400th second is still before the leap second
00085         if ( JD >= l->LeapSecondJDs[i] ) {
00086             TAI_Minus_UTC = l->LeapSeconds[i];
00087             return( TAI_Minus_UTC );
00088         }
00089     }
00090 
00091     /*
00092      * Date is pre 1972.
00093      */
00094     // Different system (leap seconds introduced in 1972). Calculate MJD first.
00095     MJD = JD - 2400000.5;
00096     if        ( JD >= 2439887.5 ) TAI_Minus_UTC = 4.2131700 + (MJD-39126.0)*0.002592;  // 1968 FEB 1 =JD 2439887.5 TAI-UTC= 4.2131700 S + (MJD - 39126.) X 0.002592  S
00097     else if   ( JD >= 2439126.5 ) TAI_Minus_UTC = 4.3131700 + (MJD-39126.0)*0.002592;  // 1966 JAN 1 =JD 2439126.5 TAI-UTC= 4.3131700 S + (MJD - 39126.) X 0.002592  S
00098     else if   ( JD >= 2439004.5 ) TAI_Minus_UTC = 3.8401300 + (MJD-38761.0)*0.002592;  // 1965 SEP 1 =JD 2439004.5 TAI-UTC= 3.8401300 S + (MJD - 38761.) X 0.001296  S
00099     else if   ( JD >= 2438820.5 ) TAI_Minus_UTC = 3.6401300 + (MJD-38761.0)*0.001296;  // 1965 MAR 1 =JD 2438820.5 TAI-UTC= 3.6401300 S + (MJD - 38761.) X 0.001296  S
00100     else if   ( JD >= 2438942.5 ) TAI_Minus_UTC = 3.7401300 + (MJD-38761.0)*0.001296;  // 1965 JUL 1 =JD 2438942.5 TAI-UTC= 3.7401300 S + (MJD - 38761.) X 0.001296  S
00101     else if   ( JD >= 2438761.5 ) TAI_Minus_UTC = 3.5401300 + (MJD-38761.0)*0.001296;  // 1965 JAN 1 =JD 2438761.5 TAI-UTC= 3.5401300 S + (MJD - 38761.) X 0.001296  S
00102     else if   ( JD >= 2438639.5 ) TAI_Minus_UTC = 3.4401300 + (MJD-38761.0)*0.001296;  // 1964 SEP 1 =JD 2438639.5 TAI-UTC= 3.4401300 S + (MJD - 38761.) X 0.001296  S
00103     else if   ( JD >= 2438395.5 ) TAI_Minus_UTC = 3.2401300 + (MJD-38761.0)*0.001296;  // 1964 JAN 1 =JD 2438395.5 TAI-UTC= 3.2401300 S + (MJD - 38761.) X 0.001296  S
00104     else if   ( JD >= 2438486.5 ) TAI_Minus_UTC = 3.3401300 + (MJD-38761.0)*0.001296;  // 1964 APR 1 =JD 2438486.5 TAI-UTC= 3.3401300 S + (MJD - 38761.) X 0.001296  S
00105     else if   ( JD >= 2438334.5 ) TAI_Minus_UTC = 1.9458580 + (MJD-37665.0)*0.0011232; // 1963 NOV 1 =JD 2438334.5 TAI-UTC= 1.9458580 S + (MJD - 37665.) X 0.0011232 S
00106     else if   ( JD >= 2437665.5 ) TAI_Minus_UTC = 1.8458580 + (MJD-37665.0)*0.0011232; // 1962 JAN 1 =JD 2437665.5 TAI-UTC= 1.8458580 S + (MJD - 37665.) X 0.0011232 S
00107     else if   ( JD >= 2437300.5 ) TAI_Minus_UTC = 1.4228180 + (MJD-37300.0)*0.001296;  // 1961 JAN 1 =JD 2437300.5 TAI-UTC= 1.4228180 S + (MJD - 37300.) X 0.001296  S
00108     else if   ( JD >= 2437512.5 ) TAI_Minus_UTC = 1.3728180 + (MJD-37300.0)*0.001296;  // 1961 AUG 1 =JD 2437512.5 TAI-UTC= 1.3728180 S + (MJD - 37300.) X 0.001296  S
00109 
00110     return( TAI_Minus_UTC );
00111 
00112 }

00117 /*
00118  * Returns a 1 if the given date is a LeapSecond date, 0 otherwise. I.e. -- a
00119  * date on which a leap second was added.
00120  */
00121 int Lgm_IsLeapSecondDay( long int Date, double *SecondsInDay, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00122 
00123     Lgm_LeapSeconds *l;
00124     int             i;
00125 
00126     l = &(c->l);
00127 
00128     /*
00129      * Parse list in reverse order.
00130      */
00131     *SecondsInDay = 86400.0;
00132     for (i=l->nLeapSecondDates-1; i>=0; i--) {
00133         if ( Date == l->LeapSecondDates[i] ) {
00134             if (i > 0) {
00135                 if ( (l->LeapSeconds[i] - l->LeapSeconds[i-1]) > 0.0) {
00136                     *SecondsInDay = 86401.0;
00137                 } else {
00138                     *SecondsInDay = 86399.0; // implies leap second deleted has never happened yet.
00139                 }
00140             }
00141             return(1); 
00142         }
00143     }
00144     return(0);
00145 
00146 }

00151 /*
00152  * Reads in the file containing leap second info and packs the results into a
00153  * Lgm_LeapSeconds Structure.
00154  */
00155 int Lgm_LoadLeapSeconds( Lgm_CTrans  *c ) {
00156 
00157     Lgm_LeapSeconds *l;
00158     int              i, n=0, N=50, Year, Month, Day;
00159     char             Line[513], LeapSecondFile[512];
00160     double           JD, Time;
00161     FILE             *fp;
00162 
00163     l = &(c->l);
00164 
00165     sprintf( LeapSecondFile, "%s/%s", LGM_EOP_DATA_DIR, "/Lgm_LeapSecondDates.dat");
00166     //printf("File = %s\n", LeapSecondFile );
00167     
00168     if ( (fp = fopen( LeapSecondFile, "r" )) != NULL ){
00169 
00170         l->nLeapSecondDates = 0;
00171         l->LeapSecondDates  = (long int *) malloc( N*sizeof(long int) );
00172         l->LeapSecondJDs    = (double *)   malloc( N*sizeof(double) );
00173         l->LeapSeconds      = (double *)   malloc( N*sizeof(double) );
00174         
00175         // read off header
00176         for (i=0;i<17; i++) fgets( Line, 512, fp );
00177 
00178         // read off data
00179         while ( fscanf( fp, "%ld %lf %lf", &l->LeapSecondDates[n], &l->LeapSecondJDs[n], &l->LeapSeconds[n] ) != EOF) { 
00180 
00181             //printf("l->LeapSecondDates[%d] = %ld, l->LeapSecondJDs[%d] = %lf, l->LeapSeconds[%d] = %g\n", 
00182             //        n, l->LeapSecondDates[n], n, l->LeapSecondJDs[n], n, l->LeapSeconds[n] );
00183             ++n; 
00184 
00185             // increase number of elements if needed
00186             if ( n>(N-1) ){
00187                 N = (int)(N*1.2);
00188                 if ( (l->LeapSecondDates = (long int *)realloc( (void *)l->LeapSecondDates, N*sizeof(long int) )) == NULL ) {
00189                     printf("Lgm_LoadLeapSeconds: Memory allocation problem (in realloc)\n");
00190                     fclose(fp);
00191                     return(LGM_ERROR);
00192                 }
00193                 if ( (l->LeapSecondJDs = (double *)realloc( (void *)l->LeapSecondJDs, N*sizeof(double) )) == NULL ) {
00194                     printf("Lgm_LoadLeapSeconds: Memory allocation problem (in realloc)\n");
00195                     fclose(fp);
00196                     return(LGM_ERROR);
00197                 }
00198                 if ( (l->LeapSeconds = (double *)realloc( (void *)l->LeapSeconds, N*sizeof(double) )) == NULL ) {
00199                     printf("Lgm_LoadLeapSeconds: Memory allocation problem (in realloc)\n");
00200                     fclose(fp);
00201                     return(LGM_ERROR);
00202                 }
00203             }
00204         }
00205         fclose(fp);
00206 
00207     } else {
00208         N = 25;
00209         l->nLeapSecondDates = N;
00210         l->LeapSecondDates  = (long int *) malloc( N*sizeof(long int) );
00211         l->LeapSecondJDs    = (double *)   malloc( N*sizeof(double) );
00212         l->LeapSeconds      = (double *)   malloc( N*sizeof(double) );
00213         l->LeapSecondDates[0]  = 19720101, l->LeapSecondJDs[0]  = 2441317.5, l->LeapSeconds[0]  = 10.0;
00214         l->LeapSecondDates[1]  = 19720701, l->LeapSecondJDs[1]  = 2441499.5, l->LeapSeconds[1]  = 11.0;
00215         l->LeapSecondDates[2]  = 19730101, l->LeapSecondJDs[2]  = 2441683.5, l->LeapSeconds[2]  = 12.0;
00216         l->LeapSecondDates[3]  = 19740101, l->LeapSecondJDs[3]  = 2442048.5, l->LeapSeconds[3]  = 13.0;
00217         l->LeapSecondDates[4]  = 19750101, l->LeapSecondJDs[4]  = 2442413.5, l->LeapSeconds[4]  = 14.0;
00218         l->LeapSecondDates[5]  = 19760101, l->LeapSecondJDs[5]  = 2442778.5, l->LeapSeconds[5]  = 15.0;
00219         l->LeapSecondDates[6]  = 19770101, l->LeapSecondJDs[6]  = 2443144.5, l->LeapSeconds[6]  = 16.0;
00220         l->LeapSecondDates[7]  = 19780101, l->LeapSecondJDs[7]  = 2443509.5, l->LeapSeconds[7]  = 17.0;
00221         l->LeapSecondDates[8]  = 19790101, l->LeapSecondJDs[8]  = 2443874.5, l->LeapSeconds[8]  = 18.0;
00222         l->LeapSecondDates[9]  = 19800101, l->LeapSecondJDs[9]  = 2444239.5, l->LeapSeconds[9]  = 19.0;
00223         l->LeapSecondDates[10] = 19810701, l->LeapSecondJDs[10] = 2444786.5, l->LeapSeconds[10] = 20.0;
00224         l->LeapSecondDates[11] = 19820701, l->LeapSecondJDs[11] = 2445151.5, l->LeapSeconds[11] = 21.0;
00225         l->LeapSecondDates[12] = 19830701, l->LeapSecondJDs[12] = 2445516.5, l->LeapSeconds[12] = 22.0;
00226         l->LeapSecondDates[13] = 19850701, l->LeapSecondJDs[13] = 2446247.5, l->LeapSeconds[13] = 23.0;
00227         l->LeapSecondDates[14] = 19880101, l->LeapSecondJDs[14] = 2447161.5, l->LeapSeconds[14] = 24.0;
00228         l->LeapSecondDates[15] = 19900101, l->LeapSecondJDs[15] = 2447892.5, l->LeapSeconds[15] = 25.0;
00229         l->LeapSecondDates[16] = 19910101, l->LeapSecondJDs[16] = 2448257.5, l->LeapSeconds[16] = 26.0;
00230         l->LeapSecondDates[17] = 19920701, l->LeapSecondJDs[17] = 2448804.5, l->LeapSeconds[17] = 27.0;
00231         l->LeapSecondDates[18] = 19930701, l->LeapSecondJDs[18] = 2449169.5, l->LeapSeconds[18] = 28.0;
00232         l->LeapSecondDates[19] = 19940701, l->LeapSecondJDs[19] = 2449534.5, l->LeapSeconds[19] = 29.0;
00233         l->LeapSecondDates[20] = 19960101, l->LeapSecondJDs[20] = 2450083.5, l->LeapSeconds[20] = 30.0;
00234         l->LeapSecondDates[21] = 19970701, l->LeapSecondJDs[21] = 2450630.5, l->LeapSeconds[21] = 31.0;
00235         l->LeapSecondDates[22] = 19990101, l->LeapSecondJDs[22] = 2451179.5, l->LeapSeconds[22] = 32.0;
00236         l->LeapSecondDates[23] = 20060101, l->LeapSecondJDs[23] = 2453736.5, l->LeapSeconds[23] = 33.0;
00237         l->LeapSecondDates[24] = 20090101, l->LeapSecondJDs[24] = 2454832.5, l->LeapSeconds[24] = 34.0;
00238         printf("Lgm_LoadLeapSeconds: Could not open Lgm_LeapSecondDates.dat file!\n");
00239         printf("                     Setting the leap second values that I know about\n");
00240         printf("                     (latest leap second I know about was introduced on\n");
00241         printf("                     %8ld (total leap seconds is %g))\n", l->LeapSecondDates[N-1], l->LeapSeconds[N-1]);
00242         return(LGM_ERROR);
00243     }
00244 
00245     l->nLeapSecondDates = n;
00246 
00247     /*
00248      * The LeapSecondDates values are the dates that the given corrections came into effect. But the actual leap second
00249      * date is the day before -- thats when the extra second was tacked on. So subtract a day from each of the dates.
00250      */
00251     for (i=0; i<l->nLeapSecondDates; i++){
00252         JD = l->LeapSecondJDs[i]+0.5; // Noon on the given date
00253         Lgm_JD_to_Date( JD-1.0, &Year, &Month, &Day, &Time );
00254         l->LeapSecondDates[i] = Year*10000 + Month*100 + Day;
00255     }
00256 
00257     return(TRUE);
00258 
00259 }

00264 /*
00265  * GPS <-> TAI Conversions
00266  */
00267 void Lgm_TAI_to_GPS( Lgm_DateTime *TAI, Lgm_DateTime *GPS, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00268 
00269     double  Time;
00270 
00271     *GPS = *TAI;
00272     GPS->Time -= 19.0/3600.0;
00273     GPS->JD   = Lgm_JD( GPS->Year, GPS->Month, GPS->Day, GPS->Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_GPS, c );
00274     GPS->Date = Lgm_JD_to_Date( GPS->JD, &GPS->Year, &GPS->Month, &GPS->Day, &Time );
00275     // Keep the time we had rather than getting it back from Lgm_JD_to_Date(). This limits roundoff error
00276     GPS->Time = Lgm_hour24( GPS->Time ); 
00277     GPS->T    = (GPS->JD - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00278     GPS->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_GPS;
00279 
00280 }
00281 
00282 void Lgm_GPS_to_TAI( Lgm_DateTime *GPS, Lgm_DateTime *TAI, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00283 
00284     double  Time;
00285 
00286     *TAI = *GPS;
00287     TAI->Time += 19.0/3600.0;
00288     TAI->JD   = Lgm_JD( TAI->Year, TAI->Month, TAI->Day, TAI->Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_TAI, c );
00289     TAI->Date = Lgm_JD_to_Date( TAI->JD, &TAI->Year, &TAI->Month, &TAI->Day, &Time );
00290     // Keep the time we had rather than getting it back from Lgm_JD_to_Date(). This limits roundoff error
00291     TAI->Time = Lgm_hour24( TAI->Time ); 
00292     TAI->T    = (TAI->JD - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00293     TAI->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_TAI;
00294 
00295 }

00300 /*
00301  * UTC <-> GPS conversions
00302  */
00303 void Lgm_UTC_to_GPS( Lgm_DateTime *UTC, Lgm_DateTime *GPS, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00304 
00305     Lgm_DateTime    TAI;
00306 
00307     // First go UTC -> TAI
00308     Lgm_UTC_to_TAI( UTC, &TAI, c );
00309 
00310     // Then go TAI->GPS
00311     Lgm_TAI_to_GPS( &TAI, GPS, c );
00312 
00313     GPS->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_GPS;
00314 
00315 }
00316 
00317 void Lgm_GPS_to_UTC( Lgm_DateTime *GPS, Lgm_DateTime *UTC, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00318 
00319     Lgm_DateTime    TAI;
00320 
00321     // First go GPS -> TAI
00322     Lgm_GPS_to_TAI( GPS, &TAI, c );
00323 
00324     // Then go TAI->UTC
00325     Lgm_TAI_to_UTC( &TAI, UTC, c );
00326 
00327     UTC->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC;
00328 
00329 }

00335 /*
00336  * GpsSeconds Routines
00337  * ----------------
00338  * Routines to compute number of SI seconds since 0h Jan 6, 1980 Some refer to
00339  * this as "GPS Time" but this is not a standard definition. (E.g., GPS Time is
00340  * often measured in whole weeks since 0h Jan 6, 1980 plus seconds into the
00341  * current week. But the week number will eventually roll over sometime soon?
00342  * The Weeks/Seconds thing is kind of useless for our purposes...)
00343  */
00344 double  Lgm_GPS_to_GpsSeconds( Lgm_DateTime *GPS ) {
00345     double  JDN, Seconds;
00346     JDN  = Lgm_JDN( GPS->Year, GPS->Month, GPS->Day );
00347     Seconds = (JDN - LGM_JD_GPS0)*86400.0 + GPS->Time*3600.0;
00348     return( Seconds );
00349 }
00350 
00351 void Lgm_GpsSeconds_to_GPS( double GpsSeconds, Lgm_DateTime *GPS ) {
00352 
00353     long int dJDN;
00354     double   tmp, JDN;
00355     dJDN = (long int)(GpsSeconds/86400.0);
00356     GPS->Time = (GpsSeconds - dJDN*86400.0)/3600.0;
00357     JDN = LGM_JD_GPS0 + dJDN;
00358     Lgm_jd_to_ymdh( JDN, &GPS->Date, &GPS->Year, &GPS->Month, &GPS->Day, &tmp);
00359     
00360     GPS->JD   = JDN + GPS->Time/24.0;
00361     GPS->T    = (GPS->JD - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00362     GPS->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_GPS;
00363 
00364 }
00365 
00366 void Lgm_GpsSeconds_to_UTC( double GpsSeconds, Lgm_DateTime *UTC, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00367     Lgm_DateTime GPS;
00368     Lgm_GpsSeconds_to_GPS( GpsSeconds, &GPS );
00369     Lgm_GPS_to_UTC( &GPS, UTC, c );
00370     UTC->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC;
00371 }
00372 
00373 double Lgm_UTC_to_GpsSeconds( Lgm_DateTime *UTC, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00374     Lgm_DateTime GPS;
00375     Lgm_UTC_to_GPS( UTC, &GPS, c );
00376     return( Lgm_GPS_to_GpsSeconds( &GPS) );
00377 }

00379 
00380 /*
00381  * TaiSeconds Routines
00382  * ----------------
00383  * Routines to compute number of SI seconds since 0h Jan 1, 1958. Some refer to
00384  * this as "TAI", but this (IMO) is a distortion of what TAI means. TAI is
00385  * really defined in terms of how many seconds it differs from UTC. But some
00386  * have essentially re-named TAI to mean number of seconds since 0h Jan 1,
00387  * 1958.  That date is releveant, but it is actually just meant to be the date
00388  * when the difference between TAI and UTC was zero.
00389  *
00390  * Here, I call the "number of SI seconds since 0h Jan 1, 1958" TaiSeconds.
00391  */
00392 double  Lgm_TAI_to_TaiSeconds( Lgm_DateTime *TAI ) {
00393     double  JDN, Seconds;
00394     JDN  = Lgm_JDN( TAI->Year, TAI->Month, TAI->Day );
00395     Seconds = (JDN - LGM_JD_TAI0)*86400.0 + TAI->Time*3600.0;
00396     return( Seconds );
00397 }
00398 
00399 void Lgm_TaiSeconds_to_TAI( double TaiSeconds, Lgm_DateTime *TAI ) {
00400 
00401     long int dJDN;
00402     double   tmp, JDN;
00403     dJDN = (long int)(TaiSeconds/86400.0);
00404     TAI->Time = (TaiSeconds - dJDN*86400.0)/3600.0;
00405     JDN = LGM_JD_TAI0 + dJDN;
00406     Lgm_jd_to_ymdh( JDN, &TAI->Date, &TAI->Year, &TAI->Month, &TAI->Day, &tmp);
00407     
00408     TAI->JD   = JDN + TAI->Time/24.0;
00409     TAI->T    = (TAI->JD - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00410     TAI->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_TAI;
00411 
00412 }
00413 
00414 void Lgm_TaiSeconds_to_UTC( double TaiSeconds, Lgm_DateTime *UTC, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00415     Lgm_DateTime TAI;
00416     Lgm_TaiSeconds_to_TAI( TaiSeconds, &TAI );
00417     Lgm_TAI_to_UTC( &TAI, UTC, c );
00418     UTC->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC;
00419 }
00420 
00421 double Lgm_UTC_to_TaiSeconds( Lgm_DateTime *UTC, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00422     Lgm_DateTime TAI;
00423     Lgm_UTC_to_TAI( UTC, &TAI, c );
00424     return( Lgm_TAI_to_TaiSeconds( &TAI) );
00425 }

00430 
00431 /*
00432  * UTC <-> TAI conversion rotuines
00433  *
00434  * Lgm_UTC_to_TAI() - converts UTC to TAI using appropriaste number of leapseconds
00435  * Lgm_TAI_to_UTC() - converts TAI to UTC using appropriaste number of leapseconds
00436  *
00437  */
00438 void Lgm_UTC_to_TAI( Lgm_DateTime *UTC, Lgm_DateTime *TAI, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00439 
00440     double  Time, DAT, JD;
00441     int     Year, Month, Day, sgn;
00442 
00443     // Set relavent fields in TAI structure.
00444     *TAI = *UTC;
00445     TAI->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_TAI;
00446     TAI->DaySeconds = 86400.0;
00447 
00448     // Get leap seconds
00449     JD = Lgm_JD( UTC->Year, UTC->Month, UTC->Day, UTC->Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC, c );
00450     DAT = Lgm_GetLeapSeconds( JD, c );
00451 
00452     // Add leap seconds to UTC time to get TAI time
00453     TAI->Time = UTC->Time + DAT/3600.0;
00454 
00455     // Convert Year,Month,Day,Time TAI into a Julian Date.(Note that the Time
00456     // argument to Lgm_JD() doesnt have to be between 0 and 24. This allows for
00457     // date roll-overs one way or the other.)
00458     TAI->JD  = Lgm_JD( TAI->Year, TAI->Month, TAI->Day, TAI->Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_TAI, c );
00459 
00460     // From the new JD, compute the Gregorian Date that the TAI Time occurred on.
00461     // This routin returns Time back out, but we will ignore it.
00462     TAI->Date = Lgm_JD_to_Date( TAI->JD, &TAI->Year, &TAI->Month, &TAI->Day, &Time );
00463 
00464     // Instead, just remap the time we have to be between 0 and 24 (limits roundoff error)
00465     TAI->Time = Lgm_hour24( TAI->Time );
00466 
00467     // Compute Julian Centuries since J2000.
00468     TAI->T = (TAI->JD - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00469 
00470     // Set Day Of Week and Day Of Week String
00471     TAI->Dow = Lgm_DayOfWeek( TAI->Year, TAI->Month, TAI->Day, TAI->DowStr );
00472 
00473     // Set Hour, Minute, Seconds
00474     Lgm_UT_to_HMSd( TAI->Time, &sgn, &TAI->Hour, &TAI->Minute, &TAI->Second );
00475 
00476     // Set Day Of Year
00477     Lgm_Doy( TAI->Date, &Year, &Month, &Day, &TAI->Doy);
00478 
00479     TAI->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_TAI;
00480 
00481     return;
00482 }
00483 
00484 /*
00485  *  TAI -> UTC 
00486  *  This rotuine is not too complicated, but its not trivial. Here is an
00487  *  outline of the problem:
00488  *
00489  *  Let,
00490  *
00491  *      u = UTC time
00492  *      t = TAI time
00493  *      f = Number of leap seconds. Its a function of u.
00494  *
00495  *  Then to convert u->t, we simply compute;
00496  *
00497  *      t = u + f(u)
00498  *
00499  *  This is straight forward and gives us no problems. However, if we need to go
00500  *  t->u, the we have to solve,
00501  *
00502  *      u = t - f(u)
00503  *
00504  *  The problem is that we need f(u) before we know what u is. Most of the time
00505  *  this is no problem because we can just assume the dates are the same. But
00506  *  if t->u maps a TAI time back across a leapsecond (from one date to a
00507  *  previous date), there will be an inconsistency in f -- we will have used a
00508  *  value for f that was too large.  We need to detect these cases and adjust
00509  *  as necessary...
00510  *
00511  *
00512  */
00513 void Lgm_TAI_to_UTC( Lgm_DateTime *TAI, Lgm_DateTime *UTC, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00514 
00515     double          t_target, f, d, tim;
00516     Lgm_DateTime    t;
00517 
00518     /*
00519      * Keep track of the TAI time we want to convert.
00520      */
00521     t_target = TAI->Time;
00522 
00523     /*
00524      * estimate of JD for UTC
00525      */
00526     d = TAI->JD;
00527 //printf("d = %lf\n", d);
00528 //printf("%d %d %d\n", TAI->Year, TAI->Month, TAI->Day);
00529 //printf("JD = %lf\n", Lgm_JD( TAI->Year, TAI->Month, TAI->Day, TAI->Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_TAI, c ));
00530 
00531     /* 
00532      * Estimate UTC using the JD of the TAI time. This is a naive first guess
00533      * at the answer.
00534      */
00535     f = Lgm_GetLeapSeconds( d, c );
00536     UTC->Time  = TAI->Time - f/3600.0; 
00537     UTC->Year  = TAI->Year; UTC->Month = TAI->Month; UTC->Day = TAI->Day;
00538 
00539     /*
00540      * convert UTC back to TAI in order verify that we have the right answer. If we
00541      * dont, we'll have to do some more work.
00542      */
00543     UTC->JD   = Lgm_JD( UTC->Year, UTC->Month, UTC->Day, UTC->Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC, c );
00544     UTC->Date = Lgm_JD_to_Date( UTC->JD, &UTC->Year, &UTC->Month, &UTC->Day, &tim );
00545     Lgm_IsLeapSecondDay( UTC->Date, &UTC->DaySeconds, c );
00546     UTC->Time = Lgm_RemapTime( UTC->Time, UTC->DaySeconds );
00547     Lgm_UTC_to_TAI( UTC, &t, c );
00548 
00549 
00550     /* 
00551      *  If subtracting the leap seconds took us back over a leapsecond
00552      *  (positive or minus), then the time will be off. We need to adjust d so
00553      *  that the calculation uses the correct number of leap seconds.
00554      */
00555     if ( fabs( t_target - t.Time ) > 0.1 ) {
00556 
00557         if ( (t_target - t.Time) > 0.1 ) {
00558             // occurs because the date we used to get leapseconds has more leap
00559             // seconds in it that we should have used.
00560             --d;
00561         } else {
00562             // occurs because the date we used to get leapseconds has fewer
00563             // leap seconds in it that we should have used. (deletions of leap
00564             // seconds has not occured yet, but theortetically could one
00565             // year...)
00566             ++d;
00567         }
00568 
00569         f = Lgm_GetLeapSeconds( d, c );
00570         UTC->Time  = TAI->Time - f/3600.0; 
00571         UTC->Year  = TAI->Year; UTC->Month = TAI->Month; UTC->Day = TAI->Day;
00572         UTC->JD = Lgm_JD( UTC->Year, UTC->Month, UTC->Day, UTC->Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC, c );
00573         UTC->Date = Lgm_JD_to_Date( UTC->JD, &UTC->Year, &UTC->Month, &UTC->Day, &tim );
00574         Lgm_IsLeapSecondDay( UTC->Date, &UTC->DaySeconds, c );
00575         UTC->Time = Lgm_RemapTime( UTC->Time, UTC->DaySeconds );
00576     }
00577     
00578 
00579     // Set relavent fields in UTC structure.
00580     UTC->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC;
00581     UTC->T          = (UTC->JD - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00582     UTC->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC;
00583     return;
00584 }
00585 
00586 
00587 
00588 /*
00589  *  TT -> TAI
00590  *  (Dont really need leap seconds here, but pass CTrans structure so all the args are the same.)
00591  */
00592 void Lgm_TT_to_TAI( Lgm_DateTime *TT, Lgm_DateTime *TAI, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00593 
00594     double  Time;
00595 
00596     *TAI      = *TT; // initially make DateTime structures the same
00597     TAI->Time = TT->Time - 32.184/3600.0;
00598     TAI->JD   = Lgm_JD( TAI->Year, TAI->Month, TAI->Day, TAI->Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_TAI, c );
00599     TAI->Date = Lgm_JD_to_Date( TAI->JD, &TAI->Year, &TAI->Month, &TAI->Day, &Time );
00600     // Keep the time we had rather than getting it back from Lgm_JD_to_Date(). This limits roundoff error
00601     TAI->Time = Lgm_hour24( TAI->Time ); 
00602     TAI->T    = (TAI->JD - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00603     TAI->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_TAI;
00604     return;
00605 
00606 }
00607 
00608 // Does Lgm_JD need leapseconds for TAI ??? check that its working ok
00609 
00610 /*
00611  *  TAI -> TT
00612  *  (Dont really need leap seconds here, but pass CTrans structure so all the args are the same.)
00613  */
00614 void Lgm_TAI_to_TT( Lgm_DateTime *TAI, Lgm_DateTime *TT, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00615 
00616     double  Time;
00617 
00618     *TT      = *TAI; // initially make DateTime structures the same
00619     TT->Time = TAI->Time + 32.184/3600.0;
00620     TT->JD   = Lgm_JD( TT->Year, TT->Month, TT->Day, TT->Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_TT, c );
00621     TT->Date = Lgm_JD_to_Date( TT->JD, &TT->Year, &TT->Month, &TT->Day, &Time );
00622     // Keep the time we had rather than getting it back from Lgm_JD_to_Date(). This limits roundoff error
00623     TT->Time = Lgm_hour24( TT->Time ); 
00624     TT->T    = (TT->JD - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00625     TT->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_TT;
00626     return;
00627 
00628 }
00629

00638 
00639 /*
00640  *  TT -> TDB ( IAU 1976 Resolution Version )
00641  */
00642 void Lgm_TT_to_TDB( Lgm_DateTime *TT, Lgm_DateTime *TDB, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00643 
00644     double  Mearth, Time;
00645 
00646     *TDB     = *TT; // initially make DateTime structures the same
00647 
00648     Mearth    = (357.53 + 35999.050*TT->T)*RadPerDeg;
00649     TDB->Time = TT->Time + ( 0.001658*sin(Mearth) + 0.000014*sin(2.0*Mearth) )/3600.0;
00650     TDB->JD   = Lgm_JD( TDB->Year, TDB->Month, TDB->Day, TDB->Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_TDB, c );
00651     TDB->Date = Lgm_JD_to_Date( TDB->JD, &TDB->Year, &TDB->Month, &TDB->Day, &Time );
00652     // Keep the time we had rather than getting it back from Lgm_JD_to_Date(). This limits roundoff error
00653     TDB->Time = Lgm_hour24( TDB->Time );
00654     TDB->T    = (TDB->JD - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00655     TDB->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_TDB;
00656 
00657     return;
00658 }
00659 
00660 
00661 
00662 /*
00663  *  TT -> TDB ( IAU 2006 Resolution Version )
00664  */
00665 void Lgm_TT_to_TDB_IAU2006( Lgm_DateTime *TT, Lgm_DateTime *TDB, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00666 
00667     double  Time;
00668 
00669     *TDB     = *TT; // initially make DateTime structures the same
00670     TDB->Time = TT->Time + (0.001658*sin( 628.3076*TT->T + 6.2401 )
00671                          + 0.000022*sin( 575.3385*TT->T + 4.2970 ) + 0.000014*sin( 1256.6152*TT->T + 6.1969 )
00672                          + 0.000005*sin( 606.9777*TT->T + 4.0212 ) + 0.000005*sin( 52.9691*TT->T + 0.4444 )
00673                          + 0.000002*sin( 21.3299*TT->T + 5.5431 ) + 0.000010*sin( 628.3076*TT->T + 4.2490 ))/3600.0;
00674 
00675     TDB->JD   = Lgm_JD( TDB->Year, TDB->Month, TDB->Day, TDB->Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_TDB, c );
00676     TDB->Date = Lgm_JD_to_Date( TDB->JD, &TDB->Year, &TDB->Month, &TDB->Day, &Time );
00677     // Keep the time we had rather than getting it back from Lgm_JD_to_Date(). This limits roundoff error
00678     TDB->Time = Lgm_hour24( TDB->Time );
00679     TDB->T    = (TDB->JD - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00680     TDB->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_TDB;
00681     return;
00682 }
00683 
00684 
00685 
00686 /*
00687  * TDB -> TT  
00688  * Unfortunately, this is a transendental equation, have to solve numerically.
00689  * The two times should be very close -- to within a few ms of each other...
00690  */
00691 void Lgm_TDB_to_TT( Lgm_DateTime *TDB, Lgm_DateTime *TT, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00692 
00693     int             done;
00694     double          max, tdb_target, Ta, Tb, Tc, Ba, Bb, Bc, Fa, Fb, Fc, Time;
00695     Lgm_DateTime    *T, *B;
00696 
00697     // start out with approximation that TT ~= TDB. This is our "initial guess".
00698     *TT = *TDB;
00699 
00700 
00701 
00702     tdb_target = TDB->Time;
00703 
00704 
00705     T = (Lgm_DateTime *) calloc( 1, sizeof(Lgm_DateTime) );
00706     B = (Lgm_DateTime *) calloc( 1, sizeof(Lgm_DateTime) );
00707 
00708     // set T to our initial guess
00709     *T  = *TDB;
00710 
00711 
00712     /*
00713      * set up bracket
00714      */
00715     max = (0.001658 + 0.000014)/3600.0; // maximum possible diff...
00716 
00717     //(Ta, Ba)
00718     Ta = tdb_target - max;
00719     T->Time = Ta; Lgm_TT_to_TDB( T, B, c ); Ba = B->Time;
00720     // Lgm_TT_to_TDB() will recast the times if they cross date boundaries.(undo this.)
00721     if ( (Ba - Ta) > 12.0 ) Ba -= 24.0;
00722     if ( (Ta - Ba) > 12.0 ) Ba += 24.0;
00723 
00724     //(Tc, Bc)
00725     Tc = tdb_target + max;
00726     T->Time = Tc; Lgm_TT_to_TDB( T, B, c ); Bc = B->Time;
00727     // Lgm_TT_to_TDB() will recast the times if they cross date boundaries.(undo this.)
00728     if ( (Bc - Tc) > 12.0 ) Bc -= 24.0;
00729     if ( (Tc - Bc) > 12.0 ) Bc += 24.0;
00730 
00731 
00732 
00733     /*
00734        F is what we want to make zero
00735        F = TDB - TDB(TT)
00736        if we converge to a soln, it should be zero.
00737     */
00738     Fa = tdb_target - Ba;
00739     Fc = tdb_target - Bc;
00740 
00741 
00742     done = FALSE;
00743     while ( !done ) {
00744 
00745 
00746         // bisect and evaluate result at new point
00747         Tb = 0.5*(Ta+Tc);
00748         T->Time = Tb; Lgm_TT_to_TDB( T, B, c ); Bb = B->Time;
00749         if ( (Bb - Tb) > 12.0 ) Bb -= 24.0;
00750         if ( (Tb - Bb) > 12.0 ) Bb += 24.0;
00751         Fb = tdb_target - Bb;
00752             
00753         if ( Fb*Fa > 0.0 ) { 
00754             // we are on the `a' side
00755             Ta = Tb;
00756             Fa = Fb;
00757         } else {
00758             // we are on the `c' side
00759             Tc = Tb;
00760             Fc = Fb;
00761         } 
00762 
00763         if ( fabs(Ta-Tc)*86400.0 < 1e-8 ){
00764             done = TRUE;
00765         }
00766 
00767 
00768     }
00769     free( T ); 
00770     free( B );
00771 
00772 
00773     // Fill in some of the other fields correctly.
00774     TT->Time = 0.5*(Ta+Tc);
00775     TT->JD   = Lgm_JD( TT->Year, TT->Month, TT->Day, TT->Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_TT, c );
00776     TT->Date = Lgm_JD_to_Date( TT->JD, &TT->Year, &TT->Month, &TT->Day, &Time );
00777     // Keep the time we had rather than getting it back from Lgm_JD_to_Date(). This limits roundoff error
00778     TT->Time = Lgm_hour24( TT->Time );
00779     TT->T    = (TT->JD - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00780     TT->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_TT;
00781 
00782     return;
00783 }
00784 
00785 
00786 void Lgm_UTC_to_TT( Lgm_DateTime *UTC, Lgm_DateTime *TT, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00787 
00788     Lgm_DateTime TAI;
00789     double       Time;
00790 
00791 //printf("\tLgm_UTC_to_TT: UTC =  "); Lgm_Print_DateTime( *UTC, 4, 8 ); printf("\n");
00792 
00793 
00794     TAI = *UTC;
00795     Lgm_UTC_to_TAI( UTC, &TAI, c );
00796 //printf("\tLgm_UTC_to_TT: TAI =  "); Lgm_Print_DateTime( TAI, 4, 8 ); printf("\n");
00797     *TT = TAI;
00798     TT->Time = TAI.Time + 32.184/3600.0;
00799     TT->JD   = Lgm_JD( TT->Year, TT->Month, TT->Day, TT->Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_TT, c );
00800     TT->Date = Lgm_JD_to_Date( TT->JD, &TT->Year, &TT->Month, &TT->Day, &Time );
00801     // Keep the time we had rather than getting it back from Lgm_JD_to_Date(). This limits roundoff error
00802     TT->Time = Lgm_hour24( TT->Time );
00803     TT->T    = (TT->JD - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00804 //printf("\tLgm_UTC_to_TT: TT =  "); Lgm_Print_DateTime( *TT, 4, 8 ); printf("\n");
00805     TT->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_TT;
00806 
00807     return;
00808 }
00809 
00810 void Lgm_TT_to_UTC( Lgm_DateTime *TT, Lgm_DateTime *UTC, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00811 
00812     Lgm_DateTime TAI;
00813     double       Time;
00814 
00815 //printf("\tLgm_TT_to_UTC: TT =  "); Lgm_Print_DateTime( *TT, 4, 8 ); printf("\n");
00816 
00817     // Go TT -> TAI
00818     TAI = *TT;
00819     Lgm_TT_to_TAI( TT, &TAI, c );
00820 //printf("\tLgm_TT_to_UTC: TAI =  "); Lgm_Print_DateTime( TAI, 4, 8 ); printf("\n");
00821 
00822     // Go TAI -> UTC
00823     Lgm_TAI_to_UTC( &TAI, UTC, c );
00824 
00825     // Fill in some of the other fields correctly
00826     UTC->JD   = Lgm_JD( UTC->Year, UTC->Month, UTC->Day, UTC->Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC, c );
00827     UTC->Date = Lgm_JD_to_Date( UTC->JD, &UTC->Year, &UTC->Month, &UTC->Day, &Time );
00828     // Keep the time we had rather than getting it back from Lgm_JD_to_Date(). This limits roundoff error
00829     UTC->Time = Lgm_hour24( UTC->Time );
00830     UTC->T    = (UTC->JD - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00831 //printf("\tLgm_TT_to_UTC: UTC =  "); Lgm_Print_DateTime( *UTC, 4, 8 ); printf("\n");
00832     UTC->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC;
00833 
00834     return;
00835 }
00836 
00837 void Lgm_UTC_to_TDB( Lgm_DateTime *UTC, Lgm_DateTime *TDB, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00838     Lgm_DateTime TT;
00839 //printf("\tLgm_UTC_to_TDB: UTC: "); Lgm_Print_DateTime( *UTC, 4, 8 ); printf("\n");
00840     Lgm_UTC_to_TT( UTC, &TT, c );
00841 //printf("\tLgm_UTC_to_TDB: TT:  "); Lgm_Print_DateTime( TT, 4, 8 ); printf("\n");
00842     Lgm_TT_to_TDB( &TT, TDB, c );
00843 //printf("\tLgm_UTC_to_TDB: TDB: "); Lgm_Print_DateTime( *TDB, 4, 8 ); printf("\n");
00844     TDB->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_TDB;
00845     return;
00846 }
00847 
00848 void Lgm_TDB_to_UTC( Lgm_DateTime *TDB, Lgm_DateTime *UTC, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00849     Lgm_DateTime TT;
00850 //printf("\tLgm_TDB_to_UTC: TDB: "); Lgm_Print_DateTime( *TDB, 4, 8 ); printf("\n");
00851     Lgm_TDB_to_TT( TDB, &TT, c );
00852 //printf("\tLgm_TDB_to_UTC: TT:  "); Lgm_Print_DateTime( TT, 4, 8 ); printf("\n");
00853     Lgm_TT_to_UTC( &TT, UTC, c );
00854 //printf("\tLgm_TDB_to_UTC: UTC: "); Lgm_Print_DateTime( *UTC, 4, 8 ); printf("\n");
00855     UTC->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC;
00856     return;
00857 }
00858 
00859 
00860 
00861 
00862 
00863 
00864 
00865 
00866 
00867 
00868 Lgm_DateTime *Lgm_DateTime_Create( int Year, int Month, int Day, double Time, int TimeSystem, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00869 
00870     double          t;
00871     Lgm_DateTime    *d;
00872 
00873     d = calloc( 1, sizeof(Lgm_DateTime) );
00874 
00875     d->Date   = Year*10000 + Month*100 + Day;
00876     d->Time   = Time;
00877     Lgm_Doy( d->Date, &d->Year, &d->Month, &d->Day, &d->Doy );
00878     d->JD     = Lgm_JD( d->Year, d->Month, d->Day, d->Time, TimeSystem, c );
00879     d->Date   = Lgm_JD_to_Date( d->JD, &d->Year, &d->Month, &d->Day, &t );
00880     // we could just set UTC->Time to the t from the previous call, but t will have
00881     // suffered round off errors. The following reduces roundoff errors.
00882     if      ( (d->Time - t) > 12.0 ) { d->Time -= 24.0; }
00883     else if ( (t - d->Time) > 12.0 ) { d->Time += 24.0; }
00884 
00885     if ( TimeSystem == LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC ) {
00886         Lgm_IsLeapSecondDay( d->Date, &d->DaySeconds, c );
00887     } else {
00888         d->DaySeconds = 86400.0;
00889     }
00890 
00891     d->Dow    = Lgm_DayOfWeek( d->Year, d->Month, d->Day, d->DowStr );
00892     d->Time   = Lgm_RemapTime( d->Time, d->DaySeconds );
00893     d->T      = (d->JD - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00894     d->fYear  = (double)d->Year + ((double)d->Doy + d->Time/24.0)/(365.0 + (double)Lgm_LeapYear(d->Year));
00895 
00896     d->TimeSystem = TimeSystem;
00897 
00898     return(d);
00899 
00900 }
00901 
00902     
00903 
00904 /*
00905  *  Fills up a UTC DateTime Structure.
00906  */
00907 int Lgm_Make_UTC( long int Date, double Time, Lgm_DateTime *UTC, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00908 
00909     double  t;
00910     int     year, month, day, doy;
00911 
00912     Lgm_Doy( Date, &year, &month, &day, &doy );
00913     UTC->Date   = year*10000 + month*100 + day;
00914     UTC->Year   = year;
00915     UTC->Month  = month;
00916     UTC->Day    = day;
00917     UTC->Doy    = doy;
00918     UTC->Dow    = Lgm_DayOfWeek( year, month, day, UTC->DowStr );
00919     UTC->Time   = Time;
00920 //printf("Date, Year, Month, Day, Doy, Time = %ld, %d %d %d %d %lf\n", UTC->Date, UTC->Year, UTC->Month, UTC->Day, UTC->Doy, UTC->Time);
00921 
00922     UTC->JD     = Lgm_JD( UTC->Year, UTC->Month, UTC->Day, UTC->Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC, c );
00923 //printf("Date, Year, Month, Day, Doy, Time = %ld, %d %d %d %d %lf\n", UTC->Date, UTC->Year, UTC->Month, UTC->Day, UTC->Doy, UTC->Time);
00924     UTC->Date   = Lgm_JD_to_Date( UTC->JD, &UTC->Year, &UTC->Month, &UTC->Day, &t );
00925 //printf("Date, Year, Month, Day, Doy, Time = %ld, %d %d %d %d %lf\n", UTC->Date, UTC->Year, UTC->Month, UTC->Day, UTC->Doy, UTC->Time);
00926     // we could just set UTC->Time to the t from the previous call, but t will have
00927     // suffered round off errors. The following reduces roundoff errors.
00928     if      ( (UTC->Time - t) > 12.0 ) { UTC->Time -= 24.0; }
00929     else if ( (t - UTC->Time) > 12.0 ) { UTC->Time += 24.0; }
00930     Lgm_IsLeapSecondDay( UTC->Date, &UTC->DaySeconds, c );
00931     UTC->Time   = Lgm_RemapTime( UTC->Time, UTC->DaySeconds );
00932     UTC->T      = (UTC->JD - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00933     UTC->fYear  = (double)UTC->Year + ((double)UTC->Doy + UTC->Time/24.0)/(365.0 + (double)Lgm_LeapYear(UTC->Year));
00934     UTC->TimeSystem = LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC;
00935 
00936     return( 1 ); // eventually return FALSE if invalid date.
00937 
00938 }
00939 
00940 /*
00941  * This routine prints out time in different ways.
00942  *
00943  * int UnicodeHMS  -- Input
00944  *                    Controls the style of printing. If TRUE it
00945  *                    prints with h, m, s as superscripts.
00946  *                    Othwewise it prints with colons.
00947  * int p           -- Input
00948  *                    Controls how many decimals to print for the seconds.
00949  *                    Max of 20 (-- although prob more than machine prec.)
00950  */
00951 void Lgm_Print_DateTime( Lgm_DateTime DT, int Style, int p ){
00952     char *Str= calloc( 128, sizeof(char) );
00953     Lgm_DateTimeToString( Str, DT, Style, p );
00954     printf("%s", Str);
00955     free(Str);
00956 }
00957 void Lgm_DateTimeToString( char *Str, Lgm_DateTime DT, int Style, int p ){
00958     int         HH, MM, SS, sgn, leapsec;
00959     int         Year, Month, d;
00960     double      S, SFRAC, Seconds, TotalSeconds;
00961     char        SecFracStr[30];
00962 
00963     leapsec = (int)(DT.DaySeconds - 86400.0);
00964 
00965     // Total Number of Seconds - leapsecs
00966     Seconds = DT.Time*3600.0;
00967     TotalSeconds = Seconds;
00968     
00969     // Hours
00970     HH = (int)(Seconds/3600.0);
00971     Seconds -= HH*3600.0;
00972 
00973     // Minutes
00974     MM = (int)(Seconds/60.0);
00975     Seconds -= MM*60.0;
00976 
00977 //    Lgm_UT_to_HMSd( DT.Time, &sgn, &HH, &MM, &S );
00978     sgn = 1;
00979 
00980 
00981     S     = fabs(Seconds)+pow(10.0, -1.0-p );
00982     SS    = (int)S;
00983     SFRAC = S-(double)SS;
00984 
00985 
00986     if (( p <= 0 ) && ( SFRAC >= 0.5)) { SS += 1; }
00987 
00988 
00989     sprintf( SecFracStr, "%.*lf", (p>=20)?20:p, SFRAC );
00990     if ( leapsec && (TotalSeconds>=86400.0) && (TotalSeconds<86401.0) ){
00991         HH = 23; MM = 59; SS = 60;
00992    } else {
00993         if (SS==(60))  { SS=0; ++MM; }
00994         if (MM==60)  { MM=0; ++HH; }
00995     }
00996 
00997      d = DT.Date; Year = d/10000;
00998      d = d - Year*10000; Month = d/100;
00999      d = d - Month*100;
01000 
01001     // probably a cleaner way to do this(?)
01002     if ( p <= 0 ) {
01003         if ( Style == 0 ) {
01004             if ( DT.TimeSystem == LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC )
01005                 sprintf( Str, "%02d-%02d-%02dT%02d:%02d:%02dZ", Year, Month, d, HH, MM, SS );
01006             else 
01007                 sprintf( Str, "%02d-%02d-%02dT%02d:%02d:%02d", Year, Month, d, HH, MM, SS );
01008         } else if ( Style == 1 ) {
01009             if ( DT.TimeSystem == LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC )
01010                 sprintf( Str, "%8ldT%02d%02d%02dZ", DT.Date, HH, MM, SS );
01011             else 
01012                 sprintf( Str, "%8ldT%02d%02d%02d", DT.Date, HH, MM, SS );
01013         } else if ( Style == 2 ) {
01014             if ( DT.TimeSystem == LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC )
01015                 sprintf( Str, "%8ld %02d:%02d:%02dZ", DT.Date, HH, MM, SS );
01016             else 
01017                 sprintf( Str, "%8ld %02d:%02d:%02d", DT.Date, HH, MM, SS );
01018         } else if ( Style == 3 ) {
01019             if (sgn<0) sprintf( Str, "%8ld -%02d:%02d:%02d", DT.Date, HH, MM, SS );
01020             else       sprintf( Str, "%8ld  %02d:%02d:%02d", DT.Date, HH, MM, SS );
01021         } else {
01022             if (sgn<0) sprintf( Str, "%8ld -%02d\u02b0 %02d\u1d50 %02d\u02e2", DT.Date, HH, MM, SS );
01023             else       sprintf( Str, "%8ld  %02d\u02b0 %02d\u1d50 %02d\u02e2", DT.Date, HH, MM, SS );
01024         }
01025     } else {
01026         if ( Style == 0 ) {
01027             if ( DT.TimeSystem == LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC )
01028                 sprintf( Str, "%02d-%02d-%02dT%02d:%02d:%02d.%sZ", Year, Month, d, HH, MM, SS, strstr(SecFracStr, ".")+1 );
01029             else 
01030                 sprintf( Str, "%02d-%02d-%02dT%02d:%02d:%02d.%s", Year, Month, d, HH, MM, SS, strstr(SecFracStr, ".")+1 );
01031         } else if ( Style == 1 ) {
01032             if ( DT.TimeSystem == LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC )
01033                 sprintf( Str, "%8ldT%02d%02d%02d.%sZ", DT.Date, HH, MM, SS, strstr(SecFracStr, ".")+1 );
01034             else 
01035                 sprintf( Str, "%8ldT%02d%02d%02d.%s", DT.Date, HH, MM, SS, strstr(SecFracStr, ".")+1 );
01036         } else if ( Style == 2 ) {
01037             if ( DT.TimeSystem == LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC )
01038                 sprintf( Str, "%8ld %02d:%02d:%02d.%sZ", DT.Date, HH, MM, SS, strstr(SecFracStr, ".")+1 );
01039             else 
01040                 sprintf( Str, "%8ld %02d:%02d:%02d.%s", DT.Date, HH, MM, SS, strstr(SecFracStr, ".")+1 );
01041         } else if ( Style == 3 ) {
01042             if (sgn<0) sprintf( Str, "%8ld -%02d:%02d:%02d.%s", DT.Date, HH, MM, SS, strstr(SecFracStr, ".")+1 );
01043             else       sprintf( Str, "%8ld  %02d:%02d:%02d.%s", DT.Date, HH, MM, SS, strstr(SecFracStr, ".")+1 );
01044         } else {
01045             if (sgn<0) sprintf( Str, "%8ld -%02d\u02b0 %02d\u1d50 %02d\u02e2.%s", DT.Date, HH, MM, SS, strstr(SecFracStr, ".")+1 );
01046             else       sprintf( Str, "%8ld  %02d\u02b0 %02d\u1d50 %02d\u02e2.%s", DT.Date, HH, MM, SS, strstr(SecFracStr, ".")+1 );
01047         }
01048     }
01049 
01050 }
01051 
01052 
01053 void Lgm_Print_SimpleTime( Lgm_DateTime *DT, int p, char *Str ){
01054     int         HH, MM, SS, sgn, leapsec;
01055     int         Year, Month, d;
01056     double      S, SFRAC, Seconds, TotalSeconds;
01057     char        SecFracStr[30];
01058 
01059     leapsec = (int)(DT->DaySeconds - 86400.0);
01060 
01061     // Total Number of Seconds - leapsecs
01062     Seconds = DT->Time*3600.0;
01063     TotalSeconds = Seconds;
01064     
01065     // Hours
01066     HH = (int)(Seconds/3600.0);
01067     Seconds -= HH*3600.0;
01068 
01069     // Minutes
01070     MM = (int)(Seconds/60.0);
01071     Seconds -= MM*60.0;
01072 
01073 //    Lgm_UT_to_HMSd( DT.Time, &sgn, &HH, &MM, &S );
01074     sgn = 1;
01075 
01076 
01077     S     = fabs(Seconds)+pow(10.0, -1.0-p );
01078     SS    = (int)S;
01079     SFRAC = S-(double)SS;
01080 
01081 
01082     if (( p <= 0 ) && ( SFRAC >= 0.5)) { SS += 1; }
01083 
01084 
01085     sprintf( SecFracStr, "%.*lf", (p>=20)?20:p, SFRAC );
01086     if ( leapsec && (TotalSeconds>=86400.0) && (TotalSeconds<86401.0) ){
01087         HH = 23; MM = 59; SS = 60;
01088    } else {
01089         if (SS==(60))  { SS=0; ++MM; }
01090         if (MM==60)  { MM=0; ++HH; }
01091     }
01092 
01093      d = DT->Date; Year = d/10000;
01094      d = d - Year*10000; Month = d/100;
01095      d = d - Month*100;
01096 
01097     // probably a cleaner way to do this(?)
01098     if ( p <= 0 ) {
01099         sprintf(Str, "%02d:%02d:%02d", HH, MM, SS );
01100     } else {
01101         sprintf(Str, "%02d:%02d:%02d.%s", HH, MM, SS, strstr(SecFracStr, ".")+1 );
01102     }
01103 
01104 }
01105 
01106 
01107 /*
01108 
01109  *  Compute the Julian Date for the given Gregorian Date and Time.
01110  *  Julian Date is the number of days since noon of Jan 1 4713 B.C.
01111  *  Only need to worry about leap seconds if TimeSystem is UTC.
01112  *  
01113  *  Computes the Julian Date for a given time. Recall that JDN is an integer
01114  *  corresponding to noon on the given Gregorian date.  Thus, 
01115  *
01116  *                  JDN - 0.5 
01117  *
01118  *  is the Julian Date at the beginning of the day. And,
01119  *
01120  *                 JDN - 0.5 + FractionOfDay 
01121  *
01122  *  is the Julian date corresponding to the given Time. Note that the Julian
01123  *  Date can be constructed from times in different time systems (e.g. UTC,
01124  *  TAI, TT, TDB, etc.). The reason this matters, is that leap seconds are
01125  *  occasionally introduced in UTC but not in the other time sytems. Thus, the
01126  *  number of seconds in a day can change in UTC.  There will be 86400 seconds
01127  *  on most days, but on leap second days there will be 86401 seconds. This
01128  *  routine first computes the number of secons in a day, then computes the
01129  *  fraction of a day. This fraction is then added on to the Julian Date at the
01130  *  beginning of the day (i.e. JDN-0.5).
01131  *  
01132  */
01133 double Lgm_JD( int Year, int Month, int Day, double Time, int TimeSystem, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
01134 
01135     long int    Date, JDN;
01136     double      ns, FracDay, JD;
01137 
01138     // Get JDN
01139     JDN = Lgm_JDN( Year, Month, Day );
01140 //printf("JDN, Year, Month, Day = %ld %d %d %d\n", JDN, Year, Month, Day);
01141 
01142     // Form Date
01143     Date = Year*10000 + Month*100 + Day;
01144 
01145     // Set number of seconds in this day -- only applies to UTC system
01146     if ( TimeSystem == LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC ) {
01147         Lgm_IsLeapSecondDay( Date, &ns, c );
01148         // Compute fractional part of current day
01149         FracDay = Time*3600.0/ns;
01150     } else {
01151         ns = 86400.0;
01152         // Compute fractional part of current day
01153         FracDay = Time/24.0;
01154     }
01155 //printf("ns = %lf\n", ns);
01156 
01157 
01158     // Shift back to midnight and then add in the Fractional part
01159     JD = JDN - 0.5 + FracDay;
01160 //printf("FracDay = %lf\n", FracDay);
01161 
01162     return( JD );
01163 
01164 }
01165 
01166 
01167 
01168 /*
01169  *  Compute the Julian Day Number for the given Gregorian Date.
01170  *  Julian Date is the number of days since noon of Jan 1 4713 B.C.
01171  *  See Expl. Suppl. to Astron. Almanac, p. 604  (2006 edition).
01172  *  The long integer number returned here is the Julian Day Number
01173  *  for Noon on the given calendar date.
01174  */
01175 long int Lgm_JDN( int Year, int Month, int Day ) {
01176     int q = (Month < 3 ) ? -1 : 0;
01177     // Compute integer part of julian date
01178     return(  (1461*(Year + 4800 + q))/4 + (367*(Month - 2 - 12*q))/12
01179             - (3*((Year + 4900 + q)/100))/4 + Day - 32075 );
01180 }
01181 
01182 
01183 
01184 double Lgm_MJD(int ny, int nm, int nd, double UT, int TimeSystem, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
01185     return( Lgm_JD( ny, nm, nd, UT, TimeSystem, c ) - 2400000.5 );
01186 }
01187 
01188 
01189 double Lgm_Date_to_JD( long int Date, double UT, Lgm_CTrans *c) {
01190 
01191     int year, month, day, doy;
01192 
01193     Lgm_Doy( Date, &year, &month, &day, &doy);
01194     return( Lgm_JD( year, month, day, UT, LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC, c) );
01195 
01196 }
01197 
01198 int Lgm_DayOfYear(int year, int month, int day, Lgm_CTrans *c) {
01199     return((int)(Lgm_JD(year, month, day, 0.0, LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC, c) - Lgm_JD(year, 1, 0, 0.0, LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC, c)));
01200 }
01201 
01202 
01203 
01204 
01205 int Lgm_DayOfWeek( int Year, int Month, int Day, char *dowstr ) {
01206 
01207     double  JD, A, Afrac;
01208     int     n, iA;
01209 
01210     JD = Lgm_JDN( Year, Month, Day );
01211     A = (JD + 1.5)/7.0;
01212     iA = (int)A;
01213     Afrac = A - (double)iA;
01214     n = (int)(Afrac*7.0 + 0.5);
01215 
01216     if      ( n == 0 ) {  strcpy(dowstr, "Sun");  }
01217     else if ( n == 1 ) {  strcpy(dowstr, "Mon");  }
01218     else if ( n == 2 ) {  strcpy(dowstr, "Tue");  }
01219     else if ( n == 3 ) {  strcpy(dowstr, "Wed");  }
01220     else if ( n == 4 ) {  strcpy(dowstr, "Thu");  }
01221     else if ( n == 5 ) {  strcpy(dowstr, "Fri");  }
01222     else if ( n == 6 ) {  strcpy(dowstr, "Sat");  }
01223 
01224     return(n);
01225 
01226 }
01227 
01228 
01229 /*
01230  *  Routine converts between day number and mmdd formats. Input date can be in any of the following
01231  *  formats;
01232  *      yyddd   (where yy is assumed to be a year in the 20th century)
01233  *      yymmdd  (where yy is assumed to be a year in the 20th century)
01234  *      yyyyddd   (where yyyy is assumed to be between 1000 A.D. and 9999 A.D.)
01235  *      yyyymmdd  (where yyyy is assumed to be between 1000 A.D. and 9999 A.D.)
01236  *
01237  *  Should be good enough for space physics! Need separate routines or add a flag or something
01238  *  if you want it to be completely general.... Its not completely general now but it is
01239  *  convenient.
01240  *
01241  */
01242 int Lgm_Doy( long int date, int *YY, int *MM, int *DD, int *DOY) {
01243 
01244     int ddd, n, i, m;
01245     double f;
01246     static double days1[] = {31, 28, 31, 30, 31, 30, 31, 31, 30, 31, 30, 31};
01247     static double days2[] = {31, 29, 31, 30, 31, 30, 31, 31, 30, 31, 30, 31};
01248 
01249     if ((date < 1e5)||((date < 1e7)&&(date > 1e6))){    /* then the date is in yyddd or yyyyddd format */
01250     *YY = (int)(date/1000.0);
01251     *DOY = date - *YY * 1000;
01252     if (date < 1e5) *YY += 1900;
01253 
01254     ddd = 0, n = 0;
01255     if (Lgm_LeapYear(*YY)){
01256         while ( (ddd+days2[n]) < *DOY) {
01257             ddd += days2[n];
01258             ++n;
01259         }
01260     }
01261     else{
01262         while ( (ddd+days1[n]) < *DOY) {
01263             ddd += days1[n];
01264             ++n;
01265         }
01266     }
01267     *MM = n+1;
01268     *DD = *DOY - ddd;
01269     }
01270     else{           /* then the date is in yymmdd or yyyymmdd format */
01271     f = date/10000.0;
01272     *YY = (int)f;
01273 
01274     f = date - *YY * 10000;
01275     *MM = (int)(f/100.0);
01276     m = *MM - 1;
01277 
01278     f = f - *MM * 100;
01279     *DD = (int)f;
01280 
01281     if (Lgm_LeapYear(  (date < 1e7) ? 1900 + *YY : *YY  )){
01282         for (i=0, ddd=0; i<m; ++i) ddd += days2[i];
01283     }
01284     else{
01285         for (i=0, ddd=0; i<m; ++i) ddd += days1[i];
01286     }
01287 
01288     *DOY = ddd + *DD;
01289 
01290     if (date < 1e7) *YY += 1900;
01291     }
01292 
01293     return( *DOY );
01294 
01295 }
01296 
01297 
01298 int Lgm_IsValidDate( long int Date ) {
01299 
01300     int yy, mm, dd, doy;
01301     static int mdays[]  = {31, 28, 31, 30, 31, 30, 31, 31, 30, 31, 30, 31};
01302     static int mdays2[] = {31, 29, 31, 30, 31, 30, 31, 31, 30, 31, 30, 31};
01303 
01304     if (Date < 0) return(0);
01305 
01306     Lgm_Doy(Date, &yy, &mm, &dd, &doy);
01307 
01308     if ((mm < 1)||(mm > 12)) return(0);
01309 
01310     if (dd < 1) return(0);
01311 
01312     if (Lgm_LeapYear(yy)){
01313         if (dd > mdays2[mm-1]) return(0);
01314     } else {
01315         if (dd > mdays[mm-1]) return(0);
01316     }
01317 
01318     /*
01319      *   Must be a valid date (at least in terms of month and day)
01320      */
01321     return(1);
01322 
01323 }
01324 
01325 double Lgm_RemapTime( double Time, double SecondsInADay ) {
01326 
01327     double  Seconds;
01328 
01329     Seconds = Time*3600.0;
01330 
01331     if ( Seconds < 0.0 )            Seconds += SecondsInADay;
01332     if ( Seconds >= SecondsInADay ) Seconds -= SecondsInADay;
01333     
01334     Time = Seconds/3600.0;
01335 
01336     return(Time);
01337 
01338 }
01339 
01340 
01341 
01342 
01343 /*
01344  * We really should examine the TimeSystem field in the Lgm_DateTime structure
01345  * and convert appropriately . But for now lets just assume input is in UTc.
01346  */
01347 double Lgm_UTC_to_TDBSeconds( Lgm_DateTime *UTC, Lgm_CTrans *c ){
01348     return( Lgm_TDBSecSinceJ2000( UTC, c ) );
01349 }
01350 double Lgm_TDBSecSinceJ2000( Lgm_DateTime *UTC, Lgm_CTrans *c ){
01351 
01352     long int        JDN;
01353     double          DaySeconds, Seconds;
01354     Lgm_DateTime    TDB;
01355 
01356     // Convet to TDB
01357     Lgm_UTC_to_TDB( UTC, &TDB, c );
01358 
01359     // Get JDN
01360     JDN = Lgm_JDN( TDB.Year, TDB.Month, TDB.Day );
01361 
01362     // Get seconds past start of day (i.e. midnight)
01363     DaySeconds = TDB.Time*3600.0;
01364 
01365     // Compute Seconds since J2000
01366     Seconds = ((JDN-LGM_JD_J2000)*86400 - 43200) + DaySeconds;
01367 
01368     return( Seconds );
01369 
01370 }
